text.0: a thousand are thy helps for us o indra a thousand lord of bays thy choice refreshments.
text.1: wealth of a thousand sorts hast thou to cheer us may precious goods come nigh to us in thousands.
text.2: may the most sapient maruts with protection with best boons brought from lofty heaven approach us.
text.3: now when their team of the most noble horses speeds even on the seas extremest limit.
text.4: close to them clings one moving in seclusion like a mans wife like a spear carried rearward.
text.5: well grasped bright decked with gold there is vāk also like to a courtly eloquent dame among them.
text.6: far off the brilliant neverweary maruts cling to the young maid as a joint possession.
text.7: the fierce gods drave not rodasī before them but wished for her to grow their friend and fellow.
text.8: when chose immortal rodasī to followshe with loose tresses and heroic spirit.
text.9: she climbed her servants chariot she like sūrya with cloudlike motion and refulgent aspect.
text.10: upon their car the young men set the maiden wedded to glory mighty in assemblies.
text.11: when your song maruts rose and with oblation the somapourer sang his hymn in worship.
text.12: i will declare the greatness of these maruts their real greatness worthy to be lauded.
text.13: how with them she though firm strongminded haughty travels to women happy in their fortune.
text.14: mitra and varuṇa they guard from censure aryaman too discovers worthless sinners firm things are overthrown that neer were shaken he prospers maruts who gives choice oblations.
text.15: none of us maruts near or at a distance hath ever reached the limit of your vigour.
text.16: they in courageous might still waxing boldly have compassed round their foemen like an ocean.
text.17: may we this day be dearest friends of indra and let us call on him in fight tomorrow.
text.18: so were we erst new might attend us daily so be with us Ṛbhukṣan of the heroes.
text.19: may this your laud may this your song o maruts sung by the poet mānas son māndārya.
text.20: bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
